item.text: The Philistines gathered their troops for battle. They assembled at Socoh in Judah. They camped in Ephes Dammim, between Socoh and Azekah.

<st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> and the <st data-num="03478" class="">Israelite</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">army</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0622" class="">assembled</st> and <st data-num="02583" class="">camped</st> in the <st data-num="06010" class="">valley</st> of <st data-num="0425" class="">Elah</st>, where they <st data-num="06186" class="">arranged</st> their <st data-num="04421" class="">battle lines</st> to <st data-num="07122" class="">fight against</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st>.
The Philistines were standing on one hill, and the Israelites on another hill, with the valley between them.
Then a champion came out from the camp of the Philistines. His name was Goliath; he was from Gath. He was close to seven feet tall.

<st data-num="01931" class="">He</st> had a <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="03553" class="">helmet</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> and was <st data-num="03847" class="">wearing</st> <st data-num="07193" class="">scale</st> <st data-num="08302" class="">body armor</st>. The <st data-num="04948" class="">weight</st> of his <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="08302" class="">body armor</st> was <st data-num="02568 0505" class="">5,000</st> <st data-num="08255" class="">shekels</st>.<n id="1" />

He had <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="04697" class="">shin guards</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="07272" class="">legs</st>, and a <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="03591" class="">javelin</st> was slung <st data-num="0996" class="">over</st> his <st data-num="03802" class="">shoulders</st>.
The shaft of his spear was like a weaver’s beam, and the iron point of his spear weighed 600 shekels. His shield bearer was walking before him.

Goliath stood and called to Israel’s troops, “Why do you come out to prepare for battle? Am I not the Philistine, and are you not the servants of Saul? Choose for yourselves a man so he may come down to me!

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> he <st data-num="03201" class="">is able</st> to <st data-num="03898" class="">fight</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> me and <st data-num="05221" class="">strike</st> me <st data-num="05221" class="">down</st>, we will <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>. But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> <st data-num="03201" class="">prevail</st> against him and <st data-num="05221" class="">strike</st> him <st data-num="05221" class="">down</st>, you will <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st> our <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> and will <st data-num="05647" class="">serve</st> us.”

Then the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistine</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> <st data-num="02778" class="">defy</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel’s</st> <st data-num="04634" class="">troops</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>! <st data-num="05414" class="">Give</st> me a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> so we can <st data-num="03898" class="">fight</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03162" class="">each other</st>!”
When Saul and all the Israelites heard these words of the Philistine, they were upset and very afraid.
Now David was the son of an Ephrathite named Jesse from Bethlehem in Judah. He had eight sons, and in Saul’s days he was old and well advanced in years.

<st data-num="03448" class="">Jesse’s</st> <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="01419" class="">oldest</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> had <st data-num="01980 01980 0310">followed</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> to <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st>. The <st data-num="08034" class="">names</st> of the<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st> were <st data-num="0446" class="">Eliab</st>, his <st data-num="01060" class="">firstborn</st>; <st data-num="041" class="">Abinadab</st>, the <st data-num="04932" class="">second</st> oldest; and <st data-num="08048" class="">Shammah</st>, the <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> oldest.

Now <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">was</st> the <st data-num="06996" class="">youngest</st>. While the <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="01419" class="">oldest</st> sons <st data-num="01980 0310">followed</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st>,
David was going back and forth from Saul in order to care for his father’s sheep in Bethlehem.
Meanwhile for 40 days the Philistine approached every morning and evening and took his position.

<st data-num="03448" class="">Jesse</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, “<st data-num="03947 04994">Take</st> your <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="0374" class="">ephah</st> of <st data-num="07039" class="">roasted grain</st> and <st data-num="02088" class="">these</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">loaves of bread</st>; <st data-num="07323" class="">go quickly</st><n id="1" /> to the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st> to your <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st>.

Also <st data-num="0935" class="">take</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="02757" class="">portions</st> of <st data-num="02461" class="">cheese</st> to their <st data-num="0505" class="">commanding</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">officer</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06485" class="">Find out</st> <st data-num="07965" class="">how</st> your <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st> are <st data-num="07965" class="">doing</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03947" class="">bring back</st> their <st data-num="06161" class="">pledge</st> that they received the goods.<n id="3" />
They are with Saul and the whole Israelite army in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.”

So David got up early in the morning and entrusted the flock to someone else who would watch over it. After loading up, he went just as Jesse had instructed him. He arrived at the camp as the army was going out to the battle lines shouting its battle cry.

<st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> and the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st> <st data-num="06186" class="">drew up</st> their <st data-num="04634" class="">battle lines</st> <st data-num="07122" class="">opposite</st> <st data-num="04634" class="">one another</st>.

After <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> had <st data-num="05203 05921">entrusted</st> his <st data-num="03627" class="">cargo</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="03027" class="">care</st> of the <st data-num="03627" class="">supply</st> <st data-num="08104" class="">officer</st>,<n id="1" /> he <st data-num="07323" class="">ran</st> to the <st data-num="04634" class="">battlefront</st>. When he <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st>, he <st data-num="07592" class="">asked</st> his <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st> <st data-num="07965" class="">how</st> they were <st data-num="07965" class="">doing</st>.

As <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> was <st data-num="01696" class="">speaking</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> them, the <st data-num="02009 0376 01143">champion</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">named</st> <st data-num="01555" class="">Goliath</st>, the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistine</st> from <st data-num="01661" class="">Gath</st>, was <st data-num="05927" class="">coming up</st> from the <st data-num="04630" class="">battle lines</st> of the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st>. He <st data-num="01696" class="">spoke</st> the <st data-num="01697" class="">way</st> he <st data-num="0428" class="">usually did</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> it.
When all the men of Israel saw this man, they retreated from his presence and were very afraid.

The men of Israel said, “Have you seen this man who is coming up? He does so to defy Israel. But the king will make the man who can strike him down very wealthy! He will give him his daughter in marriage, and he will make his father’s house exempt from tax obligations in Israel.”

David asked the men who were standing near him, “What will be done for the man who strikes down this Philistine and frees Israel from this humiliation? For who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he defies the armies of the living God?”
The soldiers told him what had been promised, saying, “This is what will be done for the man who can strike him down.”

When David’s oldest brother Eliab heard him speaking to the men, he became angry with David and said, “Why have you come down here? To whom did you entrust those few sheep in the wilderness? I am familiar with your pride and deceit! You have come down here to watch the battle.”
David replied, “What have I done now? Can’t I say anything?”

Then he <st data-num="05437" class="">turned</st> from those who were <st data-num="0681" class="">nearby</st> <st data-num="0413 04136">to</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">someone else</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st> the <st data-num="02088" class="">same</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">question</st>,<n id="1" /> but <st data-num="05971" class="">they</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="07725" class="">gave</st> him the <st data-num="01697" class="">same</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">answer</st> <st data-num="07223" class="">as before</st>.
When David’s words were overheard and reported to Saul, he called for him.
David said to Saul, “Don’t let anyone be discouraged. Your servant will go and fight this Philistine!”
But Saul replied to David, “You aren’t able to go against this Philistine and fight him. You’re just a boy! He has been a warrior from his youth.”
David replied to Saul, “Your servant has been a shepherd for his father’s flock. Whenever a lion or bear would come and carry off a sheep from the flock,

I would <st data-num="03318" class="">go out</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> it, <st data-num="05221" class="">strike</st> it <st data-num="05221" class="">down</st>, and <st data-num="05337" class="">rescue</st> the sheep from its <st data-num="06310" class="">mouth</st>. If it <st data-num="06965" class="">rose up</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> me, I would <st data-num="02388" class="">grab</st> it by its <st data-num="02206" class="">jaw</st>, <st data-num="05221" class="">strike</st> it, and <st data-num="04191" class="">kill</st> it.

Your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> has <st data-num="05221" class="">struck down</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">both</st> the <st data-num="0738" class="">lion</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="01677" class="">bear</st>. <st data-num="02088" class="">This</st> <st data-num="06189" class="">uncircumcised</st> <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistine</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> just like <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of <st data-num="01992" class="">them</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> he has <st data-num="02778" class="">defied</st> the <st data-num="04634" class="">armies</st> of the <st data-num="02416" class="">living</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>.”
David went on to say, “The Lord who delivered me from the lion and the bear will also deliver me from the hand of this Philistine.” Then Saul said to David, “Go! The Lord will be with you.”
Then Saul clothed David with his own fighting attire and put a bronze helmet on his head. He also put body armor on him.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="02296" class="">strapped</st> on his <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> his <st data-num="04055" class="">fighting attire</st> and <st data-num="02974" class="">tried</st> to <st data-num="01980" class="">walk around</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">but</st> he <st data-num="05254" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05254" class="">used to</st> them.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st>, “I <st data-num="03808 03201">can’t</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">walk</st> in <st data-num="0428" class="">these things</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> I’<st data-num="05254" class="">m</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05254" class="">used to</st> them.” So <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="05493 05921">removed</st> them.
He took his staff in his hand, picked out five smooth stones from the stream, placed them in the pouch of his shepherd’s bag, took his sling in hand, and approached the Philistine.
The Philistine, with his shield bearer walking in front of him, kept coming closer to David.

When the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistine</st> <st data-num="05027" class="">looked</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">carefully</st> at <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, he <st data-num="0959" class="">despised</st> him, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> he <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> only a <st data-num="0132" class="">ruddy</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">and</st> <st data-num="03303 04758">handsome</st> <st data-num="05288" class="">boy</st>.

The <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistine</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, “Am <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> a <st data-num="03611" class="">dog</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> are <st data-num="0935" class="">coming</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">after</st> me with <st data-num="04731" class="">sticks</st>?”<n id="1" /> Then the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistine</st> <st data-num="07043" class="">cursed</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> by his <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st>.
The Philistine said to David, “Come here to me, so I can give your flesh to the birds of the sky and the wild animals of the field!”

But David replied to the Philistine, “You are coming against me with sword and spear and javelin. But I am coming against you in the name of the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel’s armies, whom you have defied!

This very day the Lord will deliver you into my hand. I will strike you down and cut off your head. This day I will give the corpses of the Philistine army to the birds of the sky and the wild animals of the land. Then all the land will realize that Israel has a God,
and all this assembly will know that it is not by sword or spear that the Lord saves! For the battle is the Lord’s, and he will deliver you into our hand.”
The Philistine drew steadily closer to David to attack him, while David quickly ran toward the battle line to attack the Philistine.
David reached his hand into the bag and took out a stone. He slung it, striking the Philistine on the forehead. The stone sank deeply into his forehead, and he fell down with his face to the ground.
David prevailed over the Philistine with just the sling and the stone. He struck down the Philistine and killed him. David did not even have a sword in his hand.

David ran and stood over the Philistine. He grabbed Goliath’s sword, drew it from its sheath, and after killing him, he cut off his head with it. When the Philistines saw their champion was dead, they ran away.

Then the men of Israel and Judah charged forward, shouting a battle cry. They chased the Philistines to the valley and to the very gates of Ekron. The Philistine corpses lay fallen along the Shaaraim road to Gath and Ekron.

When the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">returned</st> from their <st data-num="01814" class="">hot</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">pursuit</st> of the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st>, they <st data-num="08155" class="">looted</st> their <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>.
David took the head of the Philistine and brought it to Jerusalem, and he put Goliath’s weapons in his tent.

Now as Saul watched David going out to fight the Philistine, he asked Abner, the general in command of the army, “Whose son is that young man, Abner?” Abner replied, “As surely as you live, O king, I don’t know.”
The king said, “Find out whose son this boy is.”
So when David returned from striking down the Philistine, Abner took him and brought him before Saul. He still had the head of the Philistine in his hand.
Saul said to him, “Whose son are you, young man?” David replied, “I am the son of your servant Jesse in Bethlehem.”
